text: William Clarke's All-England Eleven in 1847. Thomas Sewell (5 May 1806 – 1 November 1888) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1830 to 1853. A right-handed batsman, occasional wicket-keeper and slow underarm bowler who was mainly associated with Surrey, he made 117 known appearances in first-class matches.CricketArchive. Retrieved on 2 December 2008. He represented the Players in the Gentlemen v Players series and was an original member of William Clarke's All-England Eleven. His brother, William Sewell, played twice for Surrey, and his son, Tom Sewell junior, had a substantial career with Surrey and the All-England Eleven. ==References== Category:1806 births Category:1888 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:English cricketers of 1826 to 1863 Category:All-England Eleven cricketers Category:Players cricketers Category:Middlesex cricketers Category:Marylebone Cricket Club cricketers Category:Surrey cricketers Category:Kent cricketers Category:Surrey Club cricketers Category:Married v Single cricketers Category:Fast v Slow cricketers
title: Tom Sewell (cricketer, born 1806)
